thread.title: Property value notices show homeowners tax implications
thread.title_full: Property value notices show homeowners tax implications

title: Property value notices show homeowners tax implications
text:
Property value notices sent to show homeowners possible tax implications 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 7/7/15 9:40 am EDT - Updated: 7/7/15 9:43 am EDT 
HELENA, Montana â€” Homeowners are getting property value notices in the mail from the department of revenue as officials prepare to calculate tax bills for the first half of the fiscal year. 
The Montana Department of Revenue said in a press release that property values are used to calculate tax bills that are sent out in November. 
Reappraisal and classification notices show homeowners how a change in property value might impact their tax bill from last year to the current year. 
Homeowners have until July 22 to ask for a review of their values, and can also appeal to a state board for a reduced figure.
